result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerad D. DeJager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (1/6/17) unless a payment plan has been established.
Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as recommended by Agent.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

timeConds.notes: in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer to commence on or before 1/7/17.  Huber to include employment and any treatment as approved by Agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerad D. DeJager

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment plan granted in the amount of $40 per month commencing on 12/7  until paid in full

Defendant Jerad D. DeJager in court with attorney Jaclyn Shelton.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is State's motion to revoke TAD DPA and wishes to proceed to sentencing today; State heard; Atty. Shelton heard, Def. stipulates that there are grounds to revoke DPA and proceed to sentencing; Court notes that Def. has been terminated from TAD program and Court orders DPA revoked and finds Def. guilty on Counts 1 and 2; victm rights complied with; State heard on sentencing; Atty. Shelton heard (has paid restitution and paid DPA fees); Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence

**W/H - 24 months
- 30 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. to comm. 1/7/17; Huber to include employment and any treatment as approved by Agent. - Count 1
- CC each count
- $200 DNA surcharge and sample/each count. 
- absolute sobriety, no bars
- no drugs/drug paraph.
- counseling as directed by Agent
-
Motion hearing on November 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jerad D. DeJager in court with attorney Jaclyn Shelton.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Thompson heard on motion to extend DPA for 90 days.  Atty Shelton heard, def is in agreement w/request.  Court approves.  Atty Shelton request adjournment of TAD hearing scheduled next week, court grants.
Treatment Court Hearing on September 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

TAD staff appears. Atty Jaclyn Shelton appears in court. Defendant appears in person. Discussion held. Court sets next treatment court hearing.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Treatment Court Hearing on August 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

TAD staff appears. Defendant appears in person w/ Atty Jaclyn Shelton. Discussion held. Court sets next treatment court hearing. Ct. heard, will revoke bail from 8/18/16 at 1:30 until Monday morning at 7:30.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Treatment Court Hearing on August 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

TAD staff appears. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Jaclyn Shelton. Discussion held, I&S 7 days for period of 30 days. Court sets next treatment court hearing.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Treatment Court Hearing on August 4, 2016 at 12:30 pm.
TAD staff appears. Defendant appears in person w/Atty Shelton. Discussion held. Court sets next treatment court hearing.  Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2016 at 12:30 pm.
Treatment Court Hearing on June 30, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jerad D. DeJager in court with attorney Jaclyn Shelton. No appearance for the State of Wisconsin.  TAD staff appears. Defendant appears in person. Discussion held. Court sets next treatment court hearing.
Probation review hearing on May 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jerad D. DeJager in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Modify Bond - remove no contact and P&S. Victim rights compliance. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Defendant enters NC plea to both counts. Court accepts pleas, withholds finding of guilt and places on TAD DPA.
Parties heard on Bond Motion. Court heard and modifies bond; removes no contact.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with C.J.H., m/w dob 7/30/85.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Def. is to stay off the premises of any pawn shops.

(1:49) Defendant Jerad D. DeJager in custody via video with attorney Jessica Moeller (will appoint).  Intern Kevin Schmidt (Sempf) appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court enters NG plea on behalf; Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond: $3000 Cash w/conditions including no contact w/mother; mother is present and objects to no contact; Atty. Moeller response; RD 7/6/15 at 3:30pm & JT 8/11/15 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $3,000 PA Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with C.J.H., m/w dob 7/30/85.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Def. is to stay off premises of any pawn shops.
